name: Network Secure Computing
description: Sector template for secure network computing patents including secure tunneling, encrypted communications, secure key exchange, and network-level confidentiality/integrity.
contextDescription: Network secure computing patents protect data in transit and enable secure communication channels. Technologies include TLS/SSL, IPsec, VPN protocols, secure key exchange, network encryption, and secure session management.
scoringGuidance: Key exchange patents resistant to quantum computing threats (post-quantum crypto) score higher.
Patents enabling zero-knowledge proofs or privacy-preserving computation are high value.
Performance optimization for encrypted traffic (hardware acceleration, efficient protocols) is valuable.
Perfect forward secrecy and ephemeral key mechanisms score higher on key_management.

questions.question: What is the scope of network encryption? Score 1-3 for specific data fields, 4-6 for session/connection encryption, 7-10 for full network layer encryption (all traffic).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe encryption scope: field-level, transport, or network layer.

questions.question: How sophisticated is the key management approach? Score 1-3 for static keys, 4-6 for automated key rotation, 7-10 for advanced (ephemeral keys, PFS, post-quantum ready).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess key management: static, rotating, ephemeral, forward secrecy.

questions.question: At which network layer does this patent operate? Score 1-3 for application layer (API security), 4-6 for transport layer (TLS), 7-10 for network layer (IPsec, MACsec).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the network layer: application, transport, or network.

questions.question: Does this patent address encryption performance? Score 1-3 if performance not addressed, 4-6 for software optimization, 7-10 for hardware acceleration or novel efficient algorithms.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe performance considerations: latency, throughput, hardware offload.

questions.question: How robust is the secure channel establishment? Score 1-3 for basic handshake, 4-6 for mutual authentication, 7-10 for advanced (zero-knowledge, attestation-based, hardware-backed).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe channel establishment: handshake, authentication, attestation.
